author: cskiraly
content: It's not super fast, but it does find peers (here I've disabled discv4). Will check more in detail tomorrow.

author: cskiraly
content:
Full ramp-up took until 1:55. Slow, because we are doing random search over many peers, searching for a few, and a large part of these are already full.
As I mentioned earlier, I'm planning to introduce a devp2p-level peer exchange mechanism to speed up small network discovery performance. I plan to prototype this sometimes this month, then we can see if it helps with devnets/testnets.

author: __flcl
content: Not bad actually. Any way we can improve discv5, like with topics? I think every small network that uses discv5 should get peers efficiently, not relying a lot on other protocols

author: cskiraly
content:
Yes, there a few things in the works:
- we are working on faster random walk in our codebase. No protocol modification needed, just fast walk like in my crawler.
- there is now people working on topic index again.  If other clients are interested as well, we can move faster  ðŸ™‚
- i would like to add a peer exchange extension. Planning to do this for a while, but I haven't got to implement it yet

author: cskiraly
content: The peer exchange extension seems better fit at the devp2p level, but related.

author: cskiraly
content: One more thing to note: we have an inefficiency due to shadow forks that would be good solve. That hurts small shadow fork networks a lot.

author: __flcl
content: It would be awesome to discuss all this stuff in details
